node.excerpt: A year ago, I decided I would build my own Kubernetes cluster. As a software engineer, I either use a local single-node Kubernetes cluster, or a remote multi-node cluster, to test my work on a daily basis. I wanted to have the benefits of both, that is being able to use a multi-node cluster, without any of the latencies you can experience while working with a remote environment.

frontmatter.title: Running OpenGL Shaders on the Raspberry Pi

node.excerpt: As far as I can remember, I've always felt attracted by computer graphics. I guess I approach the field from the angle of my Mathematics background, as I see it as a universal language between machines, arts, and possibly nature. As a projection of that language, I find the OpenGL Shading Language an interesting case, at the intersection of computing and visual arts, that's concise and expressive enough to demonstrate human creativity and ingenuity.
